intro: Synaedrys cleistocarpa, commonly known as the closed fruit synaedrys, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that are typically hidden within its dense foliage. Its fruit is a dry capsule that remains closed until maturity, a feature reflected in its scientific name. Synaedrys cleistocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
